title: Cannot change expired password error 3847
author: Tuteksik
body_snippet:
Hi,
How could I in MremoteNG change expired password during connection to server. If password is expired I have an error during connection 3847, so only solution is to use windows remote desktop client to change password first then again I can use MremoteNG.

* Version used:
* Operating System and version (e.g. Windows 10 1709 x64):

comments.snippet:
Hi,
Is it possible to add a parameter (just like the rest, for example like clipboard sharing) to allow expired password change?. Now if the password is expired, you can add these 2 lines to .rdp file:
```
authentication level:i:2
enablecredsspsupport:i:0
```
Then the mstsc.exe will open the connection with a prompt to change the password.
comments.author: iCelo-git
